flashcards.english: People who are alive do not rest (There is always work to be done in life)
flashcards.notes: Teaching about continuous effort in life. Vocabulary: marĩ mũoyo (who have a soul/spirit, who are alive), Hurũka (rest), Kũhurũka (to rest). Cultural value of constant productivity

flashcards.english: The one being chased and the one chasing, both get tired (Effort is expended by all parties in a strenuous endeavor)
flashcards.notes: Grammar lesson on agent/patient forms. Kũingata (to chase) → Mũingatani (chaser/agent) + Mũingatwo (one being chased/patient). Pattern: Mũ-[verb root]-ani (agent), Mũ-[verb root]-wo (patient). Other examples: Mũrutani/Mũrutwo (teacher/student), Mũhurani/Mũhurwo (beater/beaten)
